content: I know https://backdropcms.org/project/services exists...but that's not always the same as it working :) Is anyone using Services to feed an iOS app in Backdrop?

Well... unfunny story: though I ported this, I confess I did so at a time when I was curious about all this web stuff works, and making this work was exciting and I have very little clue what I was doing. So I should actually remove myself as "maintainer" TBH, since I couldnt even tell you how well this module works. Thought back then I could do cool stuff with it, but in the end never used it.
However 13 installs and no issues inthe queue seems suspiciously stable
Though that could all be abandoned test sites.
Thanks for the transparency :)
Did you basically just do all the bare bones work to convert the D7 version to Backdrop and, when testing, you didn't get any obvious errors?
It looks like maybe @klonos did some work on it as recent as last year?

Rob Feature said:

Did you basically just do all the bare bones work to convert the D7 version to Backdrop and, when testing, you didn't get any obvious errors?

Essentially that.

@Rob Feature I basically merged the commits from the 7.x module, in order to bring us in par with it. The trigger I believe was a security update (and being part of the Bug Squad, I just did my part).
"Bug Squad" being this: https://backdropcms.org/leadership/bug-squad

...it was a security release: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/services/releases/tag/1.x-3.0.5-beta

Release 1.x-3.0.5-beta 路 backdrop-contrib/services
BACKDROP-SA-CONTRIB-2020-002 https://backdropcms.org/security/backdrop-sa-contrib-2020-002

...I have now again merged a couple of commits from 7.x and made a new release: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/services/releases

Releases 路 backdrop-contrib/services
A standardized solution for building API's so that external clients can communicate with Backdrop. - backdrop-contrib/services
@Rob Feature once (if?) you have tested this enough, and have found no major issues, then we could ditch the "beta" indicator from the releases :wink:
Yes, we are using it. We are not officially in production use but have done tons of beta
Using services and views services to an xamarin C# app that runs on both iOS and Android.
Not too many issues that have come up. I believe some of the end points are different than the last D7 version however.
I am exclusively using the JSON format option.

@Eric Vander Wal are you using Views to power your services? I'm wondering about a Backdrop replacement for Services Views module in D7 (https://www.drupal.org/project/services_views). EDIT: Just realized you said you're using Views Services...is that a separate module?
Hmm, I don't see it in my github. I think one of my team ported it. Let me grab a copy from my site and put it in github for you.
@Eric Vander Wal You Rock, thank you!

No worries. Let me know if it works. https://github.com/ericvanderwal/Services-Views

ericvanderwal/Services-Views
Backdrop services views module port from Drupal 7 version - ericvanderwal/Services-Views
Will do! I'm just in the stage of making a list of modules that exist/don't for Backdrop...so I may not know very soon, but will report back when I do.
Yeah, no rush. We are using it on our site on a daily basis. So good so far.
@Eric Vander Wal wondering why you haven't considered moving the module to the official Backdrop contrib repo.
@klonos , no reason in specific. Not sure it meets standards and honestly haven't had time.
There are a few modules from our project that should be contributed.
I am a D7 site builder for small clients, but actually a .net / c# developer, so my PHP is just basic. Someone else on my team did the work for me.
any modules you have would be appreciated, even if theyre in a github repo that isn't up to the coding standards etc. I'd always rather have something working than something perfect. :)
Ill see if I can get them organized but probably after this weekend. But just to let you know, I have a JWT services module, that returns a JWT via services when users login
and a mail login for services. So accounts can be logged in using email rather than usernames.
I'd love to see a way that modules can be contributed without being up to standards. At least that gives other developers a starting point.
And path2ban
which bans IP addrresses if they hit incorrect pages too many times. Also a port. Good for people mostly probing Wordpress sites and such.
path2ban has been a crucial tool for us to add banned ips to a firewall. Having that available would be great too.
path2ban.rar
here it is
If you want to make it release ready or such, please feel free, for anything. It should all be under the GNU licenses, the same as the original I believe.
great
i'll probably at least drop it into a repo for future use
But its been running for about 6 months now through various backdrop updates without issue.
So a good start :)

Rob Feature said:

I'd love to see a way that modules can be contributed without being up to standards. At least that gives other developers a starting point.

Just push to Backdrop contrib on GH but don't make a release. It wont be listed on backdropcms.org until you release.

@Eric Vander Wal I added it to github just so I didn't lose it :) https://github.com/bobchristenson/backdrop-path2ban/

bobchristenson/backdrop-path2ban
path2ban port of D7 for Backdrop. Contribute to bobchristenson/backdrop-path2ban development by creating an account on GitHub.
